title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - Uniurb
snippet: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a white paper exploring how the Digital Services Act (DSA) is transforming data access for platform research. He also leads the Mapping Italian News Research Program (MINE).
description: The web mention discusses Fabio Giglietto's co-authorship of a white paper on the Digital Services Act and his leadership of the Mapping Italian News Research Program (MINE) at the University of Urbino.

title: SICSS-Bologna - Summer Institute in Computational Social Science
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a faculty member at the Summer Institute in Computational Social Science (SICSS) in Bologna. His research is described as focusing on the interplay between digital media and societal transformations, particularly how digital platforms influence public opinion and democratic processes. He is recognized for his innovative use of methodologies to study political communication on social media platforms.
description: Fabio Giglietto is listed as faculty at SICSS-Bologna 2024, indicating his continued involvement in computational social science and his expertise in digital media's impact on public opinion and democratic processes.

title: Fabio Giglietto - Professore Ordinario GSPS-06/A Sociologia dei processi culturali e comunicativi - UniUrb
snippet: This page lists Fabio Giglietto as a Professor at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, detailing his courses for the academic year 2025/2026 and 2024/2025, including 'ANALISI DELLE RETI SOCIALI DIGITALI DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS', 'IA GENERATIVA E MEDIA GENERATIVE AI AND THE MEDIA', and 'INTERNET STUDIES'.
description: This is a faculty page on the University of Urbino Carlo Bo website, listing Fabio Giglietto as a professor and detailing his courses, including those related to social network analysis and AI media, for the 2024/2025 and 2025/2026 academic years.

Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop Pipeline | Sociologica
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is mentioned as an Associate Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. His research explores the relationship between information theory, media, and digital technologies and their impact on society.
description: The Sociologica article mentions Fabio Giglietto as an Associate Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, discussing his research relating information theory, media, and digital technologies to their societal impact in the context of large language models and political discourse studies on social media.

title: Scientists around the world call to protect research on one of humanity's greatest short-term threats – Disinformation
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, University of Urbino, Italy, is listed as one of the signatories of a letter calling to protect disinformation research.
description: The article discusses a letter signed by scientists, including Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, calling for the protection of disinformation research. This aligns with his expertise in disinformation studies.
